contest-event.event-date:
Nov. 2, 2013 D Borders Entertainment Contest
Borders Entertainment Contest 0 Entertainments Contest
borders-entertainment-contest
None
2 Separate Adjudicator Boxes (Entertainments)
Town Hall, Jedburgh, Scottish Borders, Scotland, UK Adj A: Philip Harper (tie-breaker) Adj B: Gareth Bowman
Theme: At least one piece by Gordon Langford within a 15 minute programme.
First Prize: The Scottish Borders Trophy & £150 : Band 11, Tullis Russell Mills Entertainment Prize: The Queen's Head Inn Shield & £150: Band 4, Jedforest Instrumental
Best Second Section Band: The Souter Ronnie Trophy & £100 : Band 11, Tullis Russell Mills Best Third Section Band: The John A. Wilson Memorial Trophy & £100 : Band 15, St Ronan's Silver Best Fourth Section Band: The Harry Pearce Memorial Trophy & £100 : Band 18, Tullis Russell Intermediate Highest placed Borders Band: St Ronan's Bicentenary Trophy : St Ronan's Silver
Best Soloist: The Walter Nichol Memorial Trophy & Medal : Katie Ankers, Soprano, Band 8 Kilmarnock Best Instrumentalist : The Jedforest Instrumental Band 150th Anniversary Trophy & Medal : Jamie Bryden, Euphonium, Band 6 Annan Best Solo Cornet : The Dave Young Trophy & Medal: Stuart Dickson, Band 3, St David's Brass Best Basses : The Bert Neil Memorial Quaich : Kerry Sneddon, David Lowrie, Allan Morrison & Michael Abbott, Band 11, Tullis Russell Mills Best Percussion : The Jenny Corbett Memorial Cup: Fiona Balsillie, Douglas Young & Glynn Forrest, Band 11, Tullis Russell Mills
Oct. 24, 2013, 1:08 p.m. Nov. 22, 2013, 2:24 p.m.
